intro: Schmidelia melanocarpa, commonly known as the black-fruited schmidelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Violaceae, which includes violets and related species. The plant is characterized by its small, showy violet flowers that bloom in late spring. Its fruit is a distinctive, dark purple to black capsule that matures in summer. Schmidelia melanocarpa is typically found in rocky or sandy soils in desert or semi-arid environments.
